title: US flags corruption as major business hurdle – The Times Group

The United States (US) State Department has said corruption remains a major obstacle to doing business in Malawi.

In its 2025 Investment Climate Statement for Malawi, the US State Department notes that although some progress has been made to curb the vice, firms with US affiliations have reported irregularities in tender processes and mining licensing.

Investors took a cautious stance at the start of the new trading month.

title: Reserve Bank of Malawi rejects K83bn in bids as government tightens borrowing
summary:
The Reserve Bank of Malawi (RBM) has rejected all bids, totaling K83.05 billion, submitted during the Treasury bills auction held on January 27, raising zero Kwacha as the government intensifies fiscal consolidation.

The central bank turned down K26.3 billion in 91-day bills, K19 billion in 182-day...
text_preview:
The Reserve Bank of Malawi (RBM) has rejected all bids, totaling K83.05 billion, submitted during the Treasury bills auction held on January 27, raising zero Kwacha as the government intensifies fiscal consolidation.

The central bank turned down K26.3 billion in 91-day bills, K19 billion in 182-day bills and K37.8 billion in 364-day bills despite strong demand.

This marks a shift in borrowing st...

title: Can fiscal pain finally heal Malawi’s economy?
summary:
When Peter Mutharika’s Democratic Progressive Party swept back into power on October 4, 2025, following the September 16 electoral victory, it inherited an economy on the brink of collapse.

Public debt had exploded from K4.4 trillion in 2020 to K22.4 trillion—a five-fold increase in just over five ...
text_preview:
When Peter Mutharika’s Democratic Progressive Party swept back into power on October 4, 2025, following the September 16 electoral victory, it inherited an economy on the brink of collapse.

Public debt had exploded from K4.4 trillion in 2020 to K22.4 trillion—a five-fold increase in just over five years.

The budget deficit ballooned from K314.8 billion in 2019-20 to K3.128 trillion for 2025- 26....

title: Tobacco Demand Drops, Raising Concerns for Farmers and the Economy
summary:
Malawi’s tobacco industry is facing a tough season. Preliminary reports show that buyers want to purchase only 170 million kilograms of tobacco in the 2025/26 season. This is 25 percent less than last year, when buyers bought 213 million kilograms.

The number of companies buying tobacco is also fal...
text_preview:
Malawi’s tobacco industry is facing a tough season. Preliminary reports show that buyers want to purchase only 170 million kilograms of tobacco in the 2025/26 season. This is 25 percent less than last year, when buyers bought 213 million kilograms.

The number of companies buying tobacco is also falling—from 11 last year to 8 this year. Experts warn that fewer buyers could push prices down, which ...
